entry.et: Middle English coper, from Old English, from Late Latin cuprum copper, from Latin (aes) Cyprium, literally, Cyprian metal

def.dt: :a common reddish metallic element that is ductile and malleable and is one of the best conductors of heat and electricity see element table
:a coin or token made of copper or bronze
:any of a subfamily (Lycaeninae of the family Lycaenidae) of small butterflies with usually copper-colored wings
:to coat or sheathe with or as if with copper
:a beech with shining coppery-red leaves that is a widely planted cultivar of a beech (Fagus sylvatica) native to Europe
:the normal sulfate that is white in the anhydrous form but blue in the crystalline hydrous form CuSO4·5H2O and that is often used as an algicide and fungicide
